text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as 

the Commercial Vehicle 

Roadworthiness (Vehicle Testing) (Amendment) Regulations 2021.

title: Order 2020) (S.I. No. 351 of 2020) and for the purpose of giving further effect
heading: 2. The Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness (Vehicle Testing) (No. 2)
text_raw:
2. The Commercial Vehicle Roadworthiness (Vehicle Testing) (No. 2) 

Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 347 of 2013) are amended – 

(a) 

in Regulation 3 – 

(i) 

by the substitution of the following definition for the 
definition of “Agricultural Vehicle Type-approval 
Framework Regulation”: 

“ 
‘Agricultural Vehicle Type-approval Framework 
Regulation’ means Regulation (EU) No. 167/2013 of the 
European Parliament and of the Council of 5 February 
20132, as amended by – 

(a) Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) No. 

1322/2014 of 19 September 20143, 

(b) Regulation (EU) 2016/1628 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 14 September 
20164, 

(c) Commission Delegated Regulation 

(EU) 

2016/1788 of 14 July 20165, 

(d) Commission Delegated Regulation 
2018/830 of 9 March 20186, and 

(EU) 

1 OJ No. L 127, 29.4.2014, p. 51. 
2 OJ No. L 60, 2.3.2013, p. 1 
3 OJ No. L 364, 18.12.2014, p. 1 
4 OJ No. L 252, 16.9.2016, p. 53 
5 OJ No. L 277, 13.10.2016, p. 1 
6 OJ No. L 140, 6.6.2018, p. 15 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 26th November, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [616] 3 

(e) Regulation (EU) 2019/519 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 19 March 
20197;”, 

(ii) by the substitution of the following definition for the 

definition of “category”: 

“ ‘category’ means – 

(a) 

(b) 

in relation to a vehicle other than a tractor, a 
category of vehicle within the meaning of 
Article 4 of the Type-approval Framework 
Regulation and 
to particular 
categories of vehicle are to those categories of 
vehicle specified in that Article, or 

references 

in relation to a tractor, a category T vehicle 
within the meaning of Article 4 of the 
Agricultural 
Type-approval 
Vehicle 
Framework Regulation;”, 

(iii) by the substitution of the following definition for the 

definition of “motor caravan”: 

“ ‘motor caravan’ has the meaning assigned to it in Annex 
I of the Type-approval Framework Regulation;”, 

(iv) by the substitution of the following definition for the 

definition of “special purpose vehicle”: 

“ ‘special purpose vehicle’ means a special purpose 
vehicle within the meaning of Annex I to the Typeapproval Framework Regulation and references to special 
purpose vehicles in a particular category are to special 
purpose vehicles in that category within the meaning of 
that Annex;”, 

(v) by the insertion of the following definition: 

“ 
‘Type-approval Framework Regulation’ means 
Regulation (EU) 2018/858 of the European Parliament and 
of the Council of 30 May 20188 on the approval and 
market surveillance of motor vehicles and their trailers, 
and of systems, components and separate technical units 
intended for such vehicles, amending Regulations (EC) No 
715/2007 and (EC) No 595/2009 and repealing Directive 
2007/46/EC, as amended by Commission Delegated 
Regulation (EU) 2021/1445 of 23 June 20219;”, and 

(vi) by the deletion of the definition of “Type-approval 

Framework Directive”, 

and 

7 OJ No. L 91, 29.3.2019, p. 42 
8 OJ No. L 151, 14.6.2018, p. 1 
9 OJ No. L 313, 6.9.2021, p. 4 

 
 
 4 [616] 

(b) by the substitution of the following regulation for Regulation 

9B: 

“Test due dates – converted vehicles 

9B. (1) Subject to paragraph (3), the first test due date for a 
converted vehicle after it has undergone a post-registration 
conversion shall be the date of conversion and each subsequent 
test due date shall be calculated by reference to that date in 
accordance with Regulation 6 as modified by Regulations 6A 
and 6B for the class of vehicle concerned. 

(2) Where, on 

the occurrence of a post-registration 
conversion, there is in force in respect of a CVR vehicle a 
certificate of roadworthiness or a test certificate within the 
meaning of section 3 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 
1961), that certificate shall be deemed to expire on the date of 
conversion. 

(3) Where the date of conversion of a CVR vehicle occurred 
during the period beginning on 28 March 2020 and ending on 30 
June 2020 – 

(a) 

(b) 

the first test due date for the vehicle shall be the date 
that is 3 months from the date of conversion, and 

each subsequent test due date for the vehicle shall be 
determined in accordance with Regulation 6 as 
modified by Regulations 6A and 6B.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

22 November, 2021. 

EAMON RYAN, 

Minister for Transport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [616] 5

title: Order 2020) (S.I. No. 351 of 2020) and for the purpose of giving further effect
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

The purpose of these regulations is to amend the Commercial Vehicle 
Roadworthiness (Vehicle Testing) (No. 2) Regulations 2013 (S.I. No. 347 of 
2013) to provide that: 

i. 

ii. 

a 3 month extension is given to test due dates for converted CVR 
vehicles with a first test due date falling during the period beginning on 
28 March 2020 and ending on 30 June 2020, or to converted CVR 
vehicles with a certificate of roadworthiness in force on 28 March 2020. 

the definitions in the regulations are in line with both the Agricultural 
Vehicle Type-approval Framework Regulation and the Type-approval 
Framework Regulations. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 6 [616]
